importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, when the Toronto Blue Jays advanced to the World Series after defeating the Seattle Mariners in Game 7 of the ALCS.
The scheduled start date of Game 1 of the World Series between the Toronto Blue Jays and the Los Angeles Dodgers.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The current postseason timeline in Major League Baseball, culminating in the World Series matchup between the Blue Jays and Dodgers.

keyTakeAways: The Toronto Blue Jays have won the American League Championship Series, defeating the Seattle Mariners 4-3 in Game 7, marking their first World Series appearance since 1993.
The Los Angeles Dodgers, with the largest payroll in baseball, are the defending champions and are four wins away from becoming the first team in 25 years to win back-to-back World Series titles.

The Blue Jays' dramatic postseason run, including a 34-run offensive output against the Yankees in the ALDS and a seven-game ALCS battle against the Mariners, highlights their resurgence after a poor 2024 season.

Shohei Ohtani’s dominant performance in Game 4 of the NLCS — with three home runs and 6.1 shutout innings — is considered one of the greatest individual games in MLB history and underscores the Dodgers' postseason dominance.
The Blue Jays’ strength in putting the ball into play contrasts with the Dodgers’ superior defense and starting pitching, though the Dodgers’ bullpen has been a recurring weakness.
The World Series is set to begin on Friday, October 24, in Toronto.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Toronto, Canada.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays won the American League Championship Series and are now headed to the World Series, marking a significant milestone in their franchise history after a long drought.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Los Angeles, California.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers are the top-seeded, heavily favored team in the postseason with a dominant performance and a history of success, making them a formidable opponent in the World Series.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Seattle, Washington.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners were the ALCS opponents of the Blue Jays and were eliminated in Game 7, highlighting their lack of World Series experience and playoff resilience.

namedEntities.name: Shohei Ohtani
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A two-way superstar player for the Los Angeles Dodgers, known for his skills as both a batter and a pitcher.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ohtani delivered a historic performance in Game 4 of the NLCS, with three home runs and 6.1 shutout innings, cementing the Dodgers' postseason dominance and drawing comparisons to the greatest individual games in baseball history.

namedEntities.name: George Springer
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A key player for the Toronto Blue Jays, known for his power-hitting.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Springer hit a late three-run home run in Game 7 of the ALCS that ended the Mariners' hopes, proving critical in the Blue Jays' elimination of Seattle.

namedEntities.name: Jeff Hoffman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A pitcher for the Toronto Blue Jays, who provided commentary after the ALCS victory.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hoffman's post-game interview emphasized the Blue Jays' resilience and ability to maintain close games throughout the series, underlining their strategic and emotional endurance.

namedEntities.name: American League Championship Series
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The postseason series determining the American League representative for the World Series.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays' 4-3 victory in the ALCS over the Mariners marks their qualification for the World Series.

namedEntities.name: National League Championship Series
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The postseason series determining the National League representative for the World Series.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers' sweep of the Brewers in the NLCS highlights their dominance in the postseason and sets the stage for a World Series matchup.

namedEntities.name: World Series
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The championship series of Major League Baseball, pitting the AL and NL champions against each other.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays and Dodgers are now set to face off in the World Series, marking a historic and high-stakes showdown between two of baseball's most successful franchises.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Toronto Blue Jays have advanced to the World Series after defeating the Seattle Mariners 4-3 in Game 7 of the American League Championship Series, marking their first appearance since 1993. The Blue Jays' comeback from a 2-0 deficit and their offensive surge in the ALDS, including 34 runs against the Yankees, underscore their resurgence. The Los Angeles Dodgers, the defending champions with the largest payroll in baseball, are set to face them in the World Series. The Dodgers have dominated the postseason, including a historic performance by Shohei Ohtani in Game 4 of the NLCS, and are favored due to their superior defense and pitching. However, the Blue Jays' offensive strength and ability to stay competitive late in games present a challenge. The World Series is scheduled to begin on October 24 in Toronto.
title: Blue Jays Head to World Series After ALCS Victory Over Mariners; Dodgers Await in Historic Showdown
